isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - INTERNATIONAL 530E I6 HEUI ENGINES - OPERATION - ATA Data Link Connector

svcproc.title: ATA Data Link Connector
svcproc.para: The six pin ATA data link connector (37) allows an electronic service tool (EST) to communicate with the ECM. The data link carries serial data transmissions between the ECM and the electronic service tool, and between the ECM and the speedo/tachometer cluster. Thus, the ECM provides vehicle and engine information to the speedo/tachometer, and the EST.

The ATA data link connector (137), which is located on the left instrument panel, has circuits in four of the six cavities. The data link circuits are a twisted wire pair because twisting the wires helps shield them from interference. The circuits are as follows:

item.para: Circuit 98X(+) is the positive data link connection, and it is fed by the positive data link connector (514), circuit 98(+), connector (190), and circuit 98(+) coming from the CEC module connector (379).

Circuit 98B(-) is the negative data link connection, and it is fed by the negative data link connector (515), circuit 98C(-), connector (190), and circuit 98C(-) coming from the ECM CEC module connector (379).
Circuit 97DL is a 12 volt feed and is fed from the battery adapter (497), circuit 14DLF, and 5A fuse F10-D. Thus, it provides power for the electronic service tool.
Circuit 11-GR is connected to ground adapter (453), and provides a ground for the electronic service tool.
